p: To demonstrate the advantage of using rotating GIXD and GIDVis we provide the example of measurements of epitaxially grown pentacene­quinone (P2O) on an Au(111) single-crystalline surface. P2O (pentacene­quinone, or pentacene-6,13-dione, C 22H 12O 2, CAS number 3029-32-1) is an organic semiconductor and is already known to exhibit several polymorphic phases (Simbrunner et al., 2018 ▸; Salzmann et al., 2011 ▸; Nam et al., 2010 ▸; Dzyabchenko et al., 1979 ▸).
